result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick L Watrous

records.addlTxt: Writ of Habeas Corpus
Writ of Habeas Corpus - SDS - 11-22-22

TOTAL BOND COVERS ALL FILES 22CM487 & 22CM512
DEFENDANT MUST POST $500 CASH
Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH L.A.W. dob 7-22-1962. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Patrick Watrous present in court, in custody via video with attorney Josh Ryan. ADA J.J. Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Initial appearance-charges/penalties explained by the Court. Deft acknowledges. Not guilty plea entered & trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Victim Impact Statement
Authorization to Appear and Act
Defendants Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
